definition: to cast or put aside/to forget for a while

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: The optimal throw of the dice is to bandy them abroad.
sentences.chinese: 掷骰子最好的点数是丢开。

sentences.english: Gradually, I was taken off the medicine and my doctors' visits grew further apart.
sentences.chinese: 渐渐地，我丢开了药罐子，看医生的次数也少了。

sentences.english: Working on a document in a window and want to get rid of all the extraneous background noise?
sentences.chinese: 想丢开干扰在一个窗口中专心弄一个文档？

sentences.english: Do you feel like quitting your job?
After sometime these pain will be thrown away.
sentences.chinese: 一段时间之后这些痛就会被丢开。

definition: to pick up (from the ground with one's hands)
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
with a lightning move of the hand
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to attempt all tasks at once/to manage every detail regardless of its importance
unable to change sth/unable to deal with
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
not to pay attention to/to leave sth as it is/to ignore
